learning_outcomes.description: Describe the underlying anatomical structures and the biomechanical characteristics for manual clinical examination and treatment techniques
Demonstrate advanced level skills of assessment and treatment of the motor system (including, articular, muscular and neural systems) within a biopsychosocial model.
Demonstrate an understanding of risk management principles in the safe and effective assessment of clients presenting problem and in the delivery of treatments.
Describe the rationale for the application of assessment and treatment techniques.
Discuss the ethical issues related to the application of assessment and treatment techniques
Explain to the client the evidence underpinning assessment and treatment techniques, as well as management approaches.

assessments.task_description:
This exam will assess practical physiotherapy skills in a practical station exam. It will cover content delivered between March 16th and March 26th.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct. 

In this course the recording of an assessment (oral/practical) performance has been waived, a record of student performance will be taken by other means such as audio recording or detailed written notes that can be referred to if a remark is required at a later date.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
Students will select a case scenario and deliver a group oral presentation that presents their clinical reasoning, physical assessment and management of the case.

The oral presentations will be delivered in person, with demonstration of physical assessment and treatment techniques relevant to the case.

In this course the recording of an assessment (oral/practical) performance has been waived, a record of student performance will be taken by other means such as audio recording or detailed written notes that can be referred to if a remark is required at a later date.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. 

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct. 

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Students are required to select a technique they used with a patient (manual, exercise, assess, treat) and write a justification for its selection for that patient. Students should discuss how the selected technique was demonstrating evidence-based practice, discussing research evidence (where possible). Students should also discuss the effectiveness of the technique and how this effectiveness was evaluated in practice.

The word limit for this assignment is strictly 500 words.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 11(23 Feb - 17 May)
learning_activities.topic:
Advanced Musculoskeletal and Sports Physiotherapy (Independent optional preparation)

Students have the option of reviewing and learning practical musculoskeletal and sports physiotherapy skills through online video instruction for preparation for their Advanced Musculoskeletal and Sports Physiotherapy Clinical Practice Intensive.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06
learning_activities.topic_title: Advanced Musculoskeletal and Sports Physiotherapy (Independent optional preparation)
learning_activities.topic_description: Advanced Musculoskeletal and Sports Physiotherapy (Independent optional preparation) Students have the option of reviewing and learning practical musculoskeletal and sports physiotherapy skills through online video instruction for preparation for their Advanced Musculoskeletal and Sports Physiotherapy Clinical Practice Intensive.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 4 To Week 13(16 Mar - 31 May)
learning_activities.topic:
Advanced Musculoskeletal and Sports Physiotherapy (Clinical practical series)

Students will learn practical musculoskeletal, sports and exercise physiotherapy skills through in-class demonstration, feedback on handling and exercise prescription, and application to clinical cases. These learning activities are undertaken in person on campus throughout weeks 4, 5, 12 and 13 of Semester.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06
